intro: Selago acocksii, commonly known as the Cape Selago, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Selago acocksii is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental appeal.
